text: Han Myeong-sook (born March 24, 1944; ) is a South Korean politician. She was the Prime Minister of South Korea from April 2006 to March 2007. She is South Korea's first female prime minister.South Korean prime minister resigns amid media speculation she may run for president IHT She was from the United New Democratic Party (UNDP) as a member of the Korean National Assembly (representative) for Ilsan-gab. She resigned as Prime Minister on March 7, 2007 and ran for President of South Korea in 2007. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Prime Ministers of South Korea
title: Han Myeong-sook
